text:
Escaping into Drowsiness

Raskolnikov, disheveled, eyes darting nervously.  
He plots his escape to America.  
Raskolnikov: “They think I’m ill! Ha-ha-ha!”  

---

Raskolnikov, clutching a cold beer bottle.  
He gulps it down, feeling a pleasant shiver.  
Raskolnikov: “Ah, sweet relief!”  

---

Raskolnikov, cozy under a quilt, eyes heavy.  
A soft sigh escapes as he drifts to sleep.  
Raskolnikov: “Just a little more…”  

---

Razumihin, hesitating in the doorway.  
Raskolnikov sits up, confused.  
Raskolnikov: “What time is it?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling ill and disoriented, contemplates escaping while experiencing a mix of discomfort and drowsiness before falling into a deep sleep.
